description: The property has recently undergone extensive refurbishment and offers highly efficient accommodation benefitting from : *New VRF comfort cooling *New LED lighting *Raised access flooring *Suspended ceilings *10 person passenger lift *High quality refurbished common areas including WC facilities *Showers *Up to 40 onsite car parking spaces offering a generous ratio of 1:260 sq ft with EV car chargers Location *Prominent, highly visible office premises with a frontage to Newtown Road, a main arterial road to Worcester city centre *Excellent access to the national motorway network - Junctions 6 and 7 of the M5 less than two miles / a five-minute drive away *Easy access to Worcester Shrub Hill (1 1/2 miles) and Worcestershire Parkway (3 1/2 miles) railway stations with frequent direct services to London, Birmingham, Cardiff and Nottingham *Birmingham Airport approximately 30 miles to the North East *Located adjacent to a large employee catchment area and other business park locations
features: Modern, headquarters office building with striking floor to ceiling windows throughout
The second floor provides accessible, quality open plan office accommodation with first class facilities

description: 1 College Precincts is a mid-terraced, period Grade II listed property arranged over the basement, ground, first and second floors. The building is of brick construction with period Georgian features and is set on an attractive street of similar properties. Internally, the property is accessed via ground floor level with an internal staircase leading to all floors. At basement level there is an office, storage room, WC and access to a rear courtyard. Over the ground to second floors, there is a mix of office space, kitchen & WC facilities, along with further storage space. There is limited metered public parking to the front of the property, along with King Street car park close by which offers competitive annual permits. Basement 231 sq ft 21.43 sq m Ground Floor 210 sq ft 19.52 sq m First Floor 358 sq ft 33.27 sq m Second Floor211 sq ft 19.62 sq m Total 1,010 sq ft 93.84 sq m Location 1 College Precincts occupies a prominent position adjacent to the street's junction with College Street (A44), situated on the immediate edge of Worcester city centre. This well located office lies underneath the western elevation of the cathedral, with it's onlook being the cathedral grounds and Cathedral Plaza Shopping Centre. Excellent public transport links are within easy reach, with Foregate Street Train Station-offering direct connections to Birmingham New Street and London Paddington-and the Crowngate Bus Station both just a short walk away, ensuring convenience for commuters and visitors alike.
features: City centre location overlooking Worcester Cathedral
Close proximity to public car parking

description: Kempsey Eco Business Park, a forward-thinking commercial destination designed to support businesses with sustainability at its core. Strategically located just off the A38, south of Worcester, this eco-friendly development offers high-quality, energy-efficient business units tailored for modern enterprises. With a strong emphasis on sustainability, Kempsey Eco Business Park incorporates renewable energy solutions, energy-efficient buildings, and green infrastructure to create an environmentally responsible workspace. The park is ideal for businesses seeking a future-proof location that aligns with corporate social responsibility goals while offering excellent accessibility and modern facilities. Join a growing community of forward-thinking businesses at Kempsey Eco Business Park, where sustainability meets commercial success. Location Kempsey is a delightful village situated 3 miles to the south of Worcester on the banks of the River Severn that can date its origins back to 1500BC when the Celts made a settlement here. It continued to be inhabited through Roman and Saxon times and played an important part in the Battle of Worcester in 1651. It currently has a population of c.4500 and is home to many locally owned businesses. Kempsey Eco Business Park can be found at the South end of the village bounded by the River Severn and the A38 Tewkesbury Road. It has excellent transport links including the M5 motorway (4 miles) and Worcester Parkway railway station (6 miles), as well as easy access by foot, bike and bus.

The office space at Ladybird Barn comprises a two-storey office building which benefits from three elevations and thus an abundance of natural light. The building is arranged over the ground and first floor and is accessed via a pedestrian door to the front of the building. Upon accessing the property there is a large reception area, two private offices, WC & kitchen facilities, along with further storage and a sever room. An internal staircase accesses the first floor which offers further office accommodation, which currently offers six offices however could be offered open plan if needed. Ground Floor1,251 sq ft 116.20 sq m First Floor1,397 sq ft 129.76 sq m Total2,648 sq ft 245.96 sq m Location Ladybird Barn lies adjacent to the A38 in Bromsgrove and is approximately one mile south of Junction 1 of the M42 and one mile east of Bromsgrove town centre. The mixed used development is accessed off Old Burcot Lane, with a prominent frontage to the busy A38. Nearby occupiers that include David Lloyd, Premier Inn, Bromsgrove Fire Station, Artrix Arts Centre and Heart of Worcestershire College. Junction 4 of the M5 motorway and Junction 1 of the M42 motorway lie close by and provide access to the M5 and M42 motorways as well as the national motorway network. Birmingham City Centre is situated approximately 15 miles to the north and Worcester City Centre is situated approximately 10 miles to the south. Bromsgrove has a mainline railway station which is situated to the east of the town. There are frequent trains to Birmingham New Street, Worcester Foregate Street and Hereford. There is also a bus station adjacent to the high street. Buses operate to a wide area of Worcestershire and the West Midlands. Birmingham Airport is around 22 miles away which equates to circa 30 mins by car.

29 Foregate Street is a characterful, multi-let office building in the heart of Worcester, ideally located next to the Crown Court and a short walk from Worcester Foregate Street station and the city's main High Street. The property offers immediate access to professional services, retail, and popular eateries, making it an ideal city centre base for a variety of business occupiers. The ground floor suite, accessed via the communal reception, comprises two offices, a kitchen and store, with communal WCs on each floor. The first floor provides bright, flexible accommodation, including a versatile office or staff breakout area with a fitted kitchen, a smaller inter-connected office, a larger open-plan space and a manager's office at the rear. The offices can be combined or adapted to suit occupier requirements, with allocated car parking and cellar storage available at additional cost. 29 Foregate Street offers a rare opportunity to occupy well-configured, city-centre office space with excellent natural light and flexible layouts. The building offers CCTV at both the front and rear of the building, as well as all internal communal areas. Building access to both the front and rear of the property is via a Paxton Door entry system. There is a zoned alarm system. Broadband access available, Ground Floor Office652 sq ft 60.57 sq m First Floor Office1,441 sq ft 133.87 sq m Location Worcester is situated 29 miles south of Birmingham, 25 miles north of Cheltenham and 132 miles north west of Central London. Worcester has excellent access to the M5 motorway, which lies adjacent to the subject property with Junction 7 being approximately one and a half miles drive south. The M5 provides access to the south west of England and north to Birmingham, Birmingham International Airport and the wider national motorway network. Worcester benefits from three mainline railway stations providing direct links into Birmingham New Street, Cheltenham, Oxford, Bristol, Cardiff and London Paddington, with London Paddington being reached in approximately two hours.
features: Ground floor office 652 sq ft (60.57 sq m)
First floor office 1,441 sq ft (133.87 sq m)

description: The property comprises a two-storey detached office building of brick cavity construction with pitched concrete tiled roof. The property benefits from timber framed double-glazed windows throughout and has been fitted with a gas-fired central system via traditional wall-mounted radiators as well as wall-mounted split-system air conditioning units. The property benefits from having approximately 12no tarmacadam surfaced car parking spaces, all located to the front of the building and the property is surrounded by well-maintained grounds. Ground Floor 990 sq ft 92 sq m First Floor 1,152 sq ft 107 sq m Total 2,142 sq ft 199 sq m Location The property is located within the popular Hampton Lovett Industrial Estate, approximately one mile north of Droitwich Town Centre. The Hampton Lovett Industrial Estate is accessed directly off the A442 which provides access to Droitwich to the south and Hartlebury and Kidderminster to the north. The location is particularly convenient for occupiers as it provides easy access to the M5 Motorway with Junction 5 situated approximately 3.25km (two miles) to the east. Birmingham city centre is situated approximately 22 miles to the north east, Bromsgrove is situated approximately 7 miles to the north east, Worcester city centre is situated approximately 8 miles to the south west, Kidderminster is situated approximately 9 miles to the north and Redditch is situated approximately 17 miles to the north east. Droitwich town centre has a main line railway station with regular trains to Birmingham to the north and Worcester to the south, and a travel time of approximately 2 hrs 35 mins to London Paddington via Worcester

summary: Industrial / Trade Counter To Let, Evesham
description: Unit 9 is a well-presented industrial/trade counter unit of steel portal frame construction, featuring an insulated profile steel roof and a combination of block and insulated steel profile elevations. The unit benefits from a glazed pedestrian entrance, an electrically operated roller shutter door and a dedicated yard/loading area with ample car parking. Situated within a well-established trade counter estate, the location has attracted a strong mix of national and regional occupiers, including Screwfix, Buildbase, Tile Giant, Topps Tiles, Tool Station and Easy Bathrooms. Total Area2,888 sq ft 268.3 sq m Location The property is situated within Evesham, to the south east of Worcestershire. Evesham is a market town within Wychavon which benefits from a population of approximately 25,000, according to the 2011 census. It is located approximately 14 miles south east of Worcester, 14 miles north east of Cheltenham, 27 miles south of Birmingham and 90 miles north west of London. Evesham benefits from good road communications being on the A44; which provides access to Worcester, Oxford and Junction 6 of the M5 motorway (in approximately 25 minutes) and on the A46; which provides access to Redditch, Tewkesbury and Junction 9 of the M5 motorway (in approximately 20 minutes). Evesham also has a mainline station which provides a direct access to the Worcester stations, Oxford and London Paddington.
features: Warehouse access via 1 roller shutter door

description: The property offers a retail / office area over the ground floor, which also provides a prominent frontage to Oxford Street. Also, at ground floor level is a rear kitchen and WC facilities, along with a small yard area. Over the first floor there is further accommodation set within three different rooms.

56 Friar Street is a Grade II listed end terrace building arranged over the ground, first and second floors. The property also benefits from a good-sized basement, which is useable and dry. The building is of brick construction surmounted by a pitched tiled roof. The property was previous used as a beauty salon, however, would be suitable for other commercial uses (offices, retail, healthcare etc.) or for conversion back to a residential premises. The M5 motorway is in close proximity to property with Junction 5 being approximately three miles by road to the north. Droitwich town centre has a main line railway station with regular trains to Birmingham to the north and Worcester to the south, and a travel time of approximately 2 hrs 35 mins to London Paddington via Worcester.

description: Units 15 & 16 Aston Fields Industrial Estate comprises a mid-terrace commercial property of steel frame construction with brick & block elevations. description: 7 Wassage Way comprises a pair of semi-detached warehouse units, current laid out and occupied as one single premises, with associated office accommodation towards the front with an ample on-site car parking provision. The building is of steel portal framed construction with brick and blockwork elevations to low level and metal cladding above, beneath a shallow metal-clad pitched roof, with intermittent translucent rooflights. The warehouse has been fitted out with modern LED lighting along with new heating. To the front of the building is a single storey office with cavity brick elevations and a pitched tiled roof. The property includes WC and kitchen facilities as well as mezzanine storage areas within the warehouse. The property benefits from having approximately 12 car parking spaces to the front of the building. Warehouse and Offices 10,032 sq ft 932 sq m Mezzanine Storage 1,152 sq ft 161 sq m Total 11,764 sq ft 1,093 sq m The property is situated on Hampton Lovett Industrial Estate to the north of Droitwich Spa. Droitwich is situated approximately seven miles to the north east of Worcester, six miles south west of Bromsgrove and 18 miles south west of Birmingham city centre. The town is situated immediately adjacent to the M5 with Junction 5 being approximately three miles from the property - this providing access north to the M42, M6 and wider national motorway network. Droitwich also benefits from a mainline railway station which provides direct access to Worcester and Birmingham New Street Stations.
features: 12 car parking spaces to the front of the property

description: 2 Falstaff House is a modern self-contained office building in immaculate condition set within the popular office development of Enigma Commercial Centre. The building benefits from its' own entrance which leads into a reception area with male & female & disabled WC facilities, along with a shower. Beyond the reception, at ground floor level there is open plan office accommodation with kitchenette. The first floor is accessed via an internal staircase or passenger lift and offers more open plan office space alongside a boardroom, a private meeting room and a further kitchen facility. 2 Falstaff House also offers allocated car parking for ten cars. The property is available as a whole or on a floor by floor basis. Ground Floor 102.27 m2 1,100 ft2 First Floor 119.76 m2 1,289 ft2 Total 222.03 m2 2,389 ft2 Location 2 Falstaff House is located on Enigma Business Park which is Malvern's main commercial / business area - being approximately two miles to the north of Great Malvern town centre, eight miles south west of Worcester city centre, 21 miles east of Hereford city centre and 26 miles north of Gloucester. Malvern benefits from good transport links with the A449 leading to Worcester city centre and the A440 connecting with Junction 7 of the M5 motorway which is approximately 7 miles to the north east. The town has two railway stations, being Malvern Link and Great Malvern

This modern industrial / warehouse unit has the following specification. Steel portal frames WC facilities Roller shutter door Pedestrian access door Allocated car parking Loading/unloading facilities Three phase electricity 6-metres eaves Block walls with external composite paneling Location Kidderminster itself is located to the north of Worcester and to the southwest of Stourbridge and has good road access to each, as well as Junctions 4, 5 and 6 of the M5 motorway. Kidderminster also has a mainline railway station which provides a direct link into Birmingham Snow Hill. The industrial estate is situated just off Silverwoods Way, on the former British Sugar Factory site, with easy access to both the Stourport Road and the main A442 Worcester Road which are two of the main arterial roads leading into Kidderminster Town Centre. In recent years, this part of Kidderminster has been totally transformed, attracting a number of high-profile occupiers along the Stourport Road and along Silverwoods Way itself, which has enhanced the area considerably making it a sought-after business location on the southern side of Kidderminster.

Hanley Workshops comprise three self-contained warehouses of brick construction. There is also a self-contained first floor office with views of the Malvern Hills. The single storey warehouses benefit from roller shutter doors to each elevation, along with pedestrian access and WC facilities. The office space is located on the first floor and benefits from a kitchen & WC's. The first floor is accessible via two ground floor staircases at each end of the building. The business park is situated two and a half miles south of Great Malvern and eight and a half miles south west of Worcester. The area benefits from good transport connections with both Junction 1 of the M50 and Junction 7 of the M5 being accessible from the property. Great Malvern also benefits from a mainline railway station which provides direct access to Worcester, Hereford and London Paddington.

This parcel of land extends to approximately 0.64 acres and offers an excellent opportunity for development (subject to planning). The site has an extant permission for an 8000 sq ft office block (identical to that shown adjacent to the site) and a lapsed consent for 6 light industrial units with office facilities above totalling 11,000 sq ft. Electricity, gas and full fibre comms are within easy reach of the site and mains water and effluent disposal are within the site. The land benefits from a prominent position alongside an established business park and the site offers potential for additional parking or external yard space, depending on the end use. This is a rare opportunity to secure a well-located development site within an established commercial environment, with flexibility for a range of potential occupiers or investors. Location Willow End is located to the south of Great Malvern and east of Malvern Wells, in a rural location near the Three Counties Show Ground. The property provides a versatile mix of private offices, open-plan workspaces and meeting areas, with modern facilities including 3 out of 5 recently replaced air conditioning units, kitchenettes and convenient restroom amenities. summary: Industrial / Trade Counter To Let, Malvern
description: Malvern Business Centre is a modern purpose-built commercial complex comprising of 9 trade counters/business units which were constructed circa 2007. The units are of modern steel portal frame construction with part block / part steel profile cladding above, surmounted by an insulated steel profile clad pitched roof incorporating brand new roof lights which provide a good amount of natural light. Internally, the unit provides a good sized ground floor warehouse / trade counter area with modern ceiling mounted halogen lighting, an electrically operated steel roller shutter door with separate pedestrian doorway and a fully sealed concrete floor. Malvern benefits from good transport communications with the A449 leading to Worcester city centre and the A4440 connecting with Junction 7 of the M5 motorway, which is approximately five miles to the north east. Malvern Business Centre is fronting yet set back from Betony Road which is the main spine road leading through Enigma Business Park and as such the unit benefits from a great deal of passing trade in this location. Other occupiers on Enigma Business Park include Screwfix, City Plumbing, Malvern Panalytical, Neoperl and Aldi. Adjacent to the business park there is Enigma Retail Park where several national retailers are represented including Boots, Morrisons, Next, McDonalds, Marks and Spencer and Caf√à Nero.

summary: Refurbished warehouse with covered yard / parking
description:
The unit provides a spacious, refurbished open-plan warehouse/workshop with roller shutter and pedestrian access. In addition to the main warehouse area, the accommodation includes five separate storage rooms, two office rooms positioned to the rear and a mezzanine storage area, suitable for storage.

The unit further benefits from a separate toilet block and a separate kitchen facility. To the front of the property is a secure covered yard area, offering versatile space suitable for parking or operational use.

The property also benefits from a substantial electricity supply (details available upon request), which will be a key advantage for power-intensive occupiers. In addition to this unit, larger units up to 10,000 sq ft (or the whole site) are available, providing flexibility to suit a wide range of requirements.
location:
The units are situated off the A38 at its junction with A442 (Kidderminster Road), with the A442 providing access to Droitwich town centre & Droitwich railway station (both under ½ mile south east of the subject).  The A38 provides direct access to Junction 5 of M5 motorway (two miles north) and Worcester (approximately six miles south).

Droitwich is one of three towns in the district of Wychavon.  It has a thriving and vibrant business community with a resident population of circa 23,000.  Junction 5 of the M5 motorway is situated within 2 miles of the Town Centre, giving access to the M42 and the M6 Motorways beyond. Access to the space is via a service road off George Baylis Road.
features: Located under 2 miles from Junction 5 or the M5 motorway

summary: Modern open plan office accommodation over two floors
description: 12 Aston Court is a modern semi-detached purpose built office building of brick main wall construction surmounted by a pitched tiled roof providing predominantly modern open plan office accommodation on the ground and first floor with good quality partitions to provide private offices and meeting room space all with modern suspended ceilings, LG3 lighting, comfort cooling, raised access floors and WC facilities on both floors.
location:
The property is situated in a prominent position on Aston Court, situated on the Bromsgrove Enterprise Park which is located approximately one and a half miles to the south of Bromsgrove town centre.  The Bromsgrove Enterprise Park offers a range of accommodation from serviced offices in Basepoint, good quality warehousing at Sapphire Court and a modern courtyard development of Aston Court.

Junction 4 of the M5 motorway and Junction 1 of the M42 motorway lie approximately three miles distant providing access to the M5 and M42 motorway as well as the national motorway network.  Birmingham city centre is situated approximately 15 miles to the north and Worcester city centre is situated approximately 10 miles to the south.  Bromsgrove has a main line railway station which is situated close to Aston Court. There are frequent trains to Birmingham new Street, Worcester Foregate Street and Hereford.  There is also a bus station adjacent to the high street.  Buses operate to a wide area of Worcestershire and the West Midlands.
features: Excellent links to the national motorway networks

description: 5 Fish Street is a compact three-storey property of traditional construction, prominently located on Fish Street. The building offers a mix of retail and office/studio accommodation with a self-contained entrance leading to the upper floors. The ground floor provides an open-plan retail space ideal for boutique retailers or creative businesses seeking a central location. The first floor and second floor offer additional workspace, consisting of rooms suitable for offices, studios, or other small business uses. The property is highly adaptable and can accommodate a variety of occupiers. Its central location, alongside flexible usage options, makes it an attractive proposition for businesses seeking affordable, multifunctional space in Worcester city centre. Ground Floor 113 sq ft 11.12 sq m First Floor 175 sq ft 21.23 sq m Second Floor172 sq ft 16.00 sq m Total Floor Area460 sq ft42.75 sq m Location Worcester is situated 29 miles south of Birmingham, 25 miles north of Cheltenham and 132 miles north west of Central London. Worcester has excellent access to the M5 motorway, which lies adjacent to the subject property with Junction 7 being approximately one and a half miles drive south. The M5 provides access to the south west of England and north to Birmingham, Birmingham International Airport and the wider national motorway network. Worcester benefits from three mainline railway stations providing direct links into Birmingham New Street, Cheltenham, Oxford, Bristol, Cardiff and London Paddington, with London Paddington being reached in approximately two hours.
features: Walking distance to Worcester Railway Stations
Close to city centre car parks

summary: Retail To Let or For Sale, Droitwich
description: The property is within easy walking distance of St Andrew's Square shopping centre and the popular Waitrose supermarket, together with local leisure facilities including Droitwich Spa Lido. 15 Victoria Square offers an end of mid terrace mixed use property. The ground floor offers access off Victoria Square into a good-sized office / retail area. The first floor offers a kitchen and WC facilities. The property benefits from air conditioning. There is also a rear yard area. The property is being sold with vacant posession. Ground Floor800 ft274.35 m2 First Floor573 ft253.29 m2 Total1,374 ft2127.64 m2 Location The property is situated in a prominent position fronting Victoria Square, close to its junction with the Ombersley Street East and Hertiage Way, on the southern edge of Droitwich Town Centre. Droitwich is a well known Worcestershire spa town with good communication links to neighbouring towns and cities, with Bromsgrove town centre being seven miles to the north east, Worcester city centre being eight miles to the south west and Birmingham city centre being twenty two miles to the north. The nearest motorway access is approximately two miles to the north east of the town centre at Junction 5 of the M5 motorway.
features: Ground and first floor town centre building

description: High Quality Industrial/Warehouse Building A high quality, state of the art, traditional steel portal framed industrial/warehouse unit with part brick and part block elevations, part insulated steel profile panel walls surmounted by an insulated steel profile panel pitched roof. The building benefits from; Electrically operated roller shutter door Separate pedestrian entrance 6 metre eaves height (capable of accommodating a mezzanine floor) Designated car parking spaces Floor loading 40 kN per sq m Power from 15 kVA (22 amps) to 40 kVA (58 amps) Fire alarm as standard Intruder alarm as standard The site will be fully managed to include landscaping and CCTV WC and Kitchenette facilities Sapphire Court is located on Bromsgrove Enterprise Park to the south of Bromsgrove town centre and accessed via Aston Road (close to the junction with Morrisons Supermarket) which links to the A38 Bromsgrove Eastern Bypass. Junctions 4 and 5 of the M5 motorway and junction 1 of the M42 motorway are within 3 miles of the property giving access to the Midlands motorway network. Birmingham city centre is situated approximately 13 miles to the north and Worcester city centre is situated approximately 12 miles to the south.

Bartleet Road is situated within the Washford area of Redditch, adjacent to Washford Industrial Estate and close to Park Farm Industrial Estate. Halfords head office is situated at the southern end of the road with the subject unit to its northern end. The subject unit form part of an estate of similar properties. Unit 6 Bartleet Road comprises an end-terrace unit accessed via a pedestrian door to both the front and back elevations, along with an electric roller door to the yard area. The unit has a secure yard, providing car parking and loading / unloading facilities. The unit has been finished to a good specification, being redecorated and having LED lighting throughout. There is a three-phase electric supply. The minimum eaves height is 4.3m with the maximum eaves height being 4.9m. There is further car parking in the estate car park, with each unit benefiting from a designated allocation of three parking spaces each. Unit 6 Ground Floor 1,988 sq ft 184.68 sq m Total 1,988 sq ft 184.68 sq m Location Redditch is located in north Worcestershire, approximately 14 miles south of Birmingham, 12 miles south west of Solihull and eight miles east of Bromsgrove. The town benefits from strong road communications with Junctions 2 and 3 of the M42 motorway lying approximately five miles to the north.
features: Roller shutter door to front of unit

description: Digital House is self-contained office premises, which is securely fenced and gated with generous parking. Both the ground floor right and first floor suites have been let. The remaining Ground Floor, Left Suite is finished to an immaculate standard with a dedicated entrance and reception, a mixture of open plan and private offices together with kitchen and WC facilities. High specification fixtures include suspended ceilings, perimeter trunking, air conditioning and LED lighting with sensors. Ground Floor, Left Suite298.41 sq m3,212 sq ft Location The property is located off the A451 Stourport Road, approximately two miles south of Kidderminster town centre and one and half miles north of Stourport-On-Severn. The property has easy access to the main A442 Worcester Road, which combined with the A451 are the two main arterial roads leading into Kidderminster Town Centre. In recent years, this part of Kidderminster has been totally transformed, attracting a number of high-profile occupiers along the Stourport Road and Silverwoods Way.
features: High specification finished to immaculate standard
Open plan offices with kitchen and WC

summary: Retail / Office / Industrial To Let, Pershore
description: The Old Mill comprises a large, detached commercial premises of traditional brick construction. The building has an open-plan retail sales area, which benefits from suspended LED lighting. Ancillary accommodation is provided at ground and first floor levels, including staff and storage areas, along with a mezzanine floor. There are approximately 20 car parking spaces. Ground Floor Sales3,400 sq ft315.87 sq m Ground Floor Ancillary 520 sq ft 48.31 sq m Mezzanine Area1,349 sq ft125.33 sq m First Floor Ancillary 306 sq ft 28.43 sq m Total5,575 sq ft 517.93 sq m Location The property is prominently located on New Road in Pershore, a well-connected Worcestershire market town approximately 10 miles from Worcester and 7 miles from Evesham. The Old Mill is positioned close to the River Avon and within easy walking distance of Pershore town centre. The location benefits from good transport links, including nearby access to the A44 and Pershore railway station with services to Worcester, Oxford and London.
features: Suitable for a variety of uses
Good access to the A44, leading to the M5 motorway

description: The Row is a meticulously designed roadside development featuring a premium selection of top specification boutique office suites, tailored for the very best independent operators. Set in the vibrant heart of Droitwich, this landmark destination serves as a unique parade for retail, leisure and business, attracting residents from across Worcestershire. Space available from 113 to 1,723 sq ft. The Row introduces a distinctive high-end offering to the area bringing a unique, place-making experience that sets a new benchmark for Droitwich. Curated by Asper Property Group, The Row offers a turn-key opportunity in a prime location and allocated parking. The Row is a collection of tastefully restored commercial suites designed to inspire. Each suite has been thoughtfully refurbished with carefully chosen materials and subtle industrial accents. From warm, neutral retail suites to welcoming communal spaces and distinctive shop fronts, every detail offers a workplace with a genuine sense of place. Droitwich offers a compelling location for business, combining strategic connectivity with a rich heritage and supportive local infrastructure. Situated in the heart of Worcestershire with excellent transport links to Birmingham, Worcester and the wider West Midlands, Droitwich Spa provides easy access to major markets while maintaining the charm and style of a historic spa town. Droitwich benefits from picturesque surroundings, a strong community spirit and a wealth of modern amenities which attracts a skilled local workforce and proactive business community.
features: Units available from ¬£300 per calendar month

description: Unit 9 comprises a modern, self-contained single-storey office building arranged to provide two suites available to let with shared communal facilities. Both suites are finished to a good standard and benefit from LED lighting, electric heating and cooling, suspended ceilings and an intruder alarm system. Each suite offers predominantly open-plan accommodation with the flexibility to incorporate private offices if required. There is also a separate partitioned meeting room, which could be made available for shared use on a booking or separate licence basis. Communal areas include a welcoming reception/entrance hall, male and female WCs and a shared kitchen, which offers basic facilities. Externally, the property benefits from on-site parking, with an allocation of approximately five spaces per suite. Location Centech Park occupies a prominent position on Fringe Meadow Road within the well-established Moons Moat North Industrial Estate - Redditch's premier business location. The park forms part of a thriving commercial hub that attracts a strong mix of regional and national occupiers. The estate benefits from outstanding transport connectivity, situated just off the A4023, which links directly to Junction 2 of the M42 within minutes. This provides easy access to the wider Midlands motorway network, including the M5, M6 and M40, ensuring efficient distribution routes across the UK. Redditch town centre lies approximately 3 miles to the west, offering a range of retail and amenity facilities, with Redditch Train Station providing direct services to Birmingham New Street in under 40 minutes. The City of Birmingham is located approximately 15 miles north, making Centech Park ideally positioned for businesses seeking excellent regional access while benefiting from a strong local labour pool and established commercial environment.
features: Can be let as a whole

summary: To Let - Industrial / Distribution Premises, Fully Fitted & Ready for Occupation
description: The property is of modern two bay steel portal frame construction incorporating integral two storey offices with canteen and locker room facilities.
location:
Evesham is located at the junction of the A44 and A46 trunk roads, approximately 17 miles to the south-east of Worcester, approximately 16 miles to the south of Redditch and 16 miles to the north of Cheltenham. Access is available to the M5 at Junction 6 (Worcester), Junction 9 (Tewkesbury) and to the M42 motorway at Junction 3 and the M40 motorway at Junction 15. 

The property is situated on the well-established Vale Business Park situated approximately 2 miles south of Evesham town centre.
features: 5 dock level loading and 3 level access loading doors
99kW solar power generated from PV panels
